title: Vermont Pastoral
provenance_text:
Luigi Lucioni [1900-1988], New York, NY, until December 1940 [1]; Walker Galleries, New York, NY [2]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1940 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 287 (listed as "Lent by the Artist") in the exhibition "Survey of American Painting" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December, 1940. 
[2]. The gallery acted as agent. See "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," page 329.
[3]. The museum purchased the painting from the exhibition in Note [1] and accessioned it on December 6, 1940.

creator.death_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
